# About Me 

- Graduated from University of Melbourne with Masters in applied econometrics 2020
- Research Assistant at Monash University 
- Committee member of R-Ladies Melbourne 

```{r edu_plot,fig.align='center', fig.width=8, fig.height=5,dpi=300, fig.showtext=TRUE,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE, cache=TRUE, eval=TRUE}
uni <- emojifont::fontawesome('fa-university')
home <- emojifont::fontawesome('fa-home')
world <- getMap(resolution = "high")
world <- world %>% st_as_sf()
cities <- st_sfc(
    st_point(c(116.44163,39.925494)),
    st_point(c(145.138,-37.9083)),
    st_point(c(144.9614,-37.7963))
  ) %>%
  st_sf(name = c('Beijing','Monash University','University of Melbourne')) %>%
  st_set_crs(4326) %>%
  mutate(label = c(paste(home, sep = " "), rep(uni,2)))
routes <- cities %>%
  points2line() %>%
  slice(c(2,7,12)) %>%
  st_segmentize(units::set_units(100, m))
ggplot(data = world) +
  geom_sf(color = 'white', lwd = 0.1) +
  xlab("") + ylab("") +
  geom_sf_text(
    data = cities,
    aes(label = label),
    size = 3,
    color = '#009ACD',
    family = "fontawesome-webfont"
  ) +
  geom_sf(
    data = routes, color = '#009ACD', size = 0.5, alpha = 0.5, linetype = 'dotted'
  ) +
  coord_sf(crs = '+proj=robin', xlim = c(0, 45000000), ylim =NULL) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.grid = element_line(color = 'transparent'),
     plot.margin = margin(-8, -24, -10, 0, "cm"),
    # axis.text = element_blank(),
    # axis.title = element_blank()
  )
```

# About you 

- No need to turn on your camera for the tutorials 
- This is an engaging lab tutorial, so I would like that we all get involved during the tutorials by asking questions and sending messages to the chat 
- [A fun activity to get to know each other better](https://padlet.com/danyangdai/9ajtn24ix7hq8ho2)

# House Keeping 

- Please try to use the forum for questions 
- Please check the forum for similar questions and only post new questions to the forum
- Please check the announcements for any updates in the course 
- If you would like to change tutorials, please use Allocate+ to join a tutorial 
- No tutorials are recorded

# Assignments 
- Assignment 2 and 3 will be group projects (more information about assignments 2 and 3 shortly)
- Compulsory team mates evaluation of your group members. These evaluations are for the effort and contributions. Please help out each other in the group and learn and work together as a team. 
- Use R Markdown to reader the pdf version of the assignment. (R Markdown is the best for doing assignments and generating reproducible repports)
